Ireland‚Äôs 50% funding of the Rapid Response Mechanism is an expression of solidarity with environmental defenders across Europe & Central Asia. In addition to giving a voice to environmental defenders in our own region, it may serve as a model of best practice beyond the ECE.

Increased resources in @Dept_ECC and its Agencies will support the delivery of a second Renewable Electricity Support Scheme (RESS 2) auction, the first Offshore Renewable Electricity Scheme (ORESS), and to ensure continued security of electricity supply. #EnergyTransformation
üçÉ‚Ç¨31m is for improving energy efficiency and increasing the use of renewable energy in businesses and across the public sector;

‚òÄÔ∏è‚Ç¨10m is for the Solar PV Scheme ‚Äì to help domestic customers who install roof-top solar photovoltaic (PV) equipment on their homes. This allocation will provide for an increase in grant applications, as part of the transition to the proposed Micro-generation Support Scheme.

üè¶A new low-cost loan scheme for residential retrofitting will be introduced. This part-Exchequer and part-EU funded scheme will enable credit institutions to offer loans at reduced interest rates ‚Äì making energy upgrades more affordable.

The Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage will invest a further ‚Ç¨85m as part of the Local Authority Retrofit Programme in 2022. This will deliver approximately 2,400 B2 retrofits of Local Authority homes next year.

‚Ç¨109m of this ‚Ç¨202m allocation will be used to provide free energy efficiency upgrades to households that are in, or at risk of, energy poverty. Over 4,500 upgrades will be carried out under these @SEAI_ie schemes.

#Budget2022 commits ‚Ç¨202m in carbon tax revenue to fund the @SEAI_ie residential and community retrofit schemes and a further ‚Ç¨10m from the Exchequer for the Solar PV scheme.  üè†It will deliver warmer, healthier and more comfortable homes with lower energy bills.
